revised_title: Investigation of Boundary Energy in Metals and its Relation to Crystal Orientation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on lead and tin to study the surface energy and structure of crystal boundaries in metals. They found that the energy decreases progressively as the difference of crystal orientation decreases. The results support the 'transitional lattice' theory of the crystal boundary and are consistent with Shockley and Read's theoretical predictions based on a dislocation model of the transition boundary.
